A prototype/Version 1.0 of the Scenario Editor will be provided with the ability to generate separate scenarios. These scenarios will feed into the game engine executable, loading in specific configuration items that will directly influence the scenario that plays out. Completing or failing any scenario will generate reportable metrics, stored in a database for future reporting and incorporation into trend analysis.Phase II work will likely branch out into more complex and configurable scenarios and scenario packages, along with updated control schemes for the game end-user. These control schemes will likely include efforts in the Augmented Reality or Virtual Reality game space, which will allow for even higher fidelity and significant realism within the game world itself.

award_title: WANDER:WHTS Airman Navigation and Direction EstimatoR
research_keywords: Wearable Head Tracker System (WHTS),digital vision,Image Registration,Video geolocation,Near-to-eye (NTE) display,dismounted operators,Battlefield Air Operations,BAO
abstract: ABSTRACT: The Design Knowledge Companys (TDKCs) proposed WHTS Airman Navigation and Direction EstimatoR (WANDER) is a technique that combines innovative image feature selection, registration, tracking, and helmet position and angle calculation processes to provide accurate battlefield airman (BA) helmet orientation in geospatial coordinates.WANDER includes four principal components: (1) a helmet-mounted camera, (2) a Helmet Angle Calculator that includes Object Locator, Offset Detector, and Angle Estimator functions; and (3) a Position/Orientation Analyzer and Calculator that produces accurate, absolute helmet position and angular orientation in geospatial coordinates.The TDKC team is well-qualified to perform this research due to our related helmet tracking experience, success with similar development projects, and proven expertise with sensing, video/image processing, image registration, and real-time computing technologies.During Phase I, we will build, test, and demonstrate a WANDER Feasibility Testbedan early functional prototype to experimentally and analytically assess feasibility and to verify and demonstrate our feasibility conclusions to the Air Force.We will also produce a preliminary design that includes size, weight, and power (SWaP) assessment and an architecture and plan for integration into a BAO kit for testing in Phase II.Our Phase I effort will also produce an initial commercialization assessment.; BENEFIT: WANDER integrates innovative image processing and other sensing technologies to provide accurate battlefield airman (BA) helmet tracking at real-time video speed, using TDKCs existing and proven image registration technique, the Simple Topographical Area Registration Engine or STARE, and an automatic feature selection technique to assist the registration.WANDER provides this helmet tracking in a small-volume, transportable package with no setup or calibration requirements, and autonomous operation. WANDER offers cost-effective and accurate helmet tracking and geospatial positioning advantages to numerous government or military organizations that need to track helmets (or other objects) in real-time with high accuracy. Commercial applications are significant, predominantly in the gaming and security domains, as well self-orienting robots, drones or UAVsanywhere a camera can be mounted.WANDER is a lower-cost, higher-speed alternative to tracking vehicle, personnel, or object motion and geolocation in general, which may occur in numerous reconnaissance, surveillance, or other missions.

award_title: Enhanced Day/Night Dismounted Soldier Head Tracker System
research_keywords: Wearable Head Tracker System,WHTS,head-up display,night vision goggles,dismounted operators,Battlefield Air Operations,BAO,Special Operations Forces
abstract: ABSTRACT: The Air Force is seeking a wearable head-tracker system for use with dismounted operators digital vision devices to enable symbol placement conformal to the real world without perceptible lag or artifacts. In response, Physical Optics Corporation (POC) proposes to develop a new Enhanced Day/Night Dismounted Soldier Head Tracker (ENSiHT) system based on the unique integration of state-of-the-art and proven day-time head tracker with a set of new enabling glue logic (including hardware and algorithms) to greatly improve and tailor the head tracker to be operated in night and GPS-denied environments. The innovation in implementing compatible glue logic enables the uses of digital night-vision devices and additional navigation sensors for new operation capabilities that achieve low latency, low jitter, and high accuracy. In Phase I, POC will design the ENSiHT system meeting size, weight, and power (SWaP) requirements; estimate latency, accuracy, and jitter; fit the ENSiHT system with the dismounted Battlefield Air Operations (BAO) Kit, and develop a system implementation plan for evaluation in combat environments. In Phase II, we plan to fabricate an ENSiHT prototype system, develop a test plan, optimize its SWaP performance, reliability, and ruggedization, and develop a roadmap for technology transitions.; BENEFIT: ENSiHT will provide, for the first time, a comprehensive wearable head-tracker system that can be used in GPS-denied environments day or night, to improve visualization accuracy and symbol representation for heads-up and head-mounted display technologies. Military applications of the ENSiHT technology include the BAO Kit, navigation in GPS-denied operations including vehicles, UAVs, and dismounted operators. Gaming, simulation and training, and commercial aviation via future HMDs (including augmented and virtual realities) are the many commercial applications that we envision that can be derived from the ENSiHT technology. ENSiHT can be used in logistics and shipping in order to provide safety or instructions for detailed operations or repairs and maintenance. ENSiHT can be used to enrich heads-up and head-mounted visualization for sports and outdoor activities, team coordination for emergency response, and individual team member and milestone location display. For training, ENSiHT can enrich virtual scenarios by bringing virtual agents to life, making training more immersive.

award_title: Software Architecture Evaluation Tool for Evaluating Offeror Proposals
research_keywords: Quantify contractor quality,Quantify software system quality,quality impact on software cost,rating contract code,buyer protection system,Acquisition,design quality problems,
abstract: ABSTRACT: Government organizations have difficulty assessing and improving the quality of software systemsdue to limited visibility into system modularity and architecture quality.It isalso difficult to quantify the financial value of software quality.With increasing awareness that design quality reduces defects, improves performance, and reduces cost, the government needs better ways to assess quality early to reduce long-term total cost of ownership.Silverthread leverages the research of Alan MacCormack, Carliss Baldwin, and Daniel Sturtevant to assess code and architecture quality and correlate software systems quality to software system cost, agility, and maintainability. Through this assessment, Silverthread may be able to forecast cost, waste, schedule, etc., more specifically identify quality challenges, and make recommendations that will improve the ROI of software systems investments in maintenance, re-write, and refactoring.; BENEFIT: - Improve success rate of IT investment decisions regarding re-writing or re-factoring software systems- Improve the ability to assess quality of a software system and manage future costs, schedules, and responsiveness- Improve the ability to assess the quality of a third party contractor- Improve the ability to assess and understand the relative quality of a software system against an internal or external benchmark.

award_title: Case Based Reasoning System for Software Architecture Evaluation and Insight (CBR Insight)
research_keywords: Software,Architecture,Acquisitions,source selection,case based reasoning,Static Code Analysis,Complexity
abstract: ABSTRACT: The architectural complexity of a software code base has a significant impact on its operability, maintainability, and extensibility. In general, as the complexity increases, so do the number of bugs, the amount of time required to fix each bug, and the amount of time required to adjust existing features or add new features to the software. We propose to build the Case Based Reasoning System for Software Architecture Evaluation and Insight (CBR Insight), to provide contracting officials with a tool they can use to measure and understand the ramifications of architectural complexity.CBR Insight will combine the functionality of a leading COTS static analysis tool with case based reasoning techniques from artificial intelligence and leverage existing visualization and automation software. The result is a tool capable of generating the propagation cost and core size metrics and fully leveraging these results to provide insight into operational performance, risks, and costs.During Phase I we will develop use cases and requirements, design the CBR Insight system, build a limited prototype, evaluate the prototype on open-source DOD projects, gather feedback, and develop a plan for Phase II.; BENEFIT: The most direct targets for marketing the results of this effort are contracting officials and others involved in government and commercial software acquisition. CBR Insight would be especially attractive to this market given that it is an analysis tool designed for non-developers. By demonstrating significant results in evaluating and understanding the ramifications of software architectural complexity in Phase II, CBR Insight will provide the US Air Force with a strong incentive to fund the Phase III deployment of the proposed system.A secondary target of this effort is to market CBR Insight as an extension to the existing COTS code analysis tool that CBR Insight will be integrated with. CBR Insight would provide powerful new capabilities that would be of interest to current and new software developers utilizing their system. Additionally, any development team being evaluated on these architectural complexity metrics would need to put tools in place to monitor metric scores throughout the development process.

award_title: Simplified Aero Model Development and Validation Environment
research_keywords: Aerodynamics,aerial refueling,Aeromodel,Aeromap,CFD,Guidance and Control,Component Aerodynamics,Fast Running Simulation
abstract: ABSTRACT: Shortcomings, including high costs and lack of realism, associated with classical approaches in aircrew training have motivated the desire to develop a virtual aerial refueling training environment.Such an environment has the potential to provide a cost-effective, realistic environment to perform repetition training.A vital facet of such a training tool is the development of a realistic aircraft aerodynamics model for tanker aircraft, drogue, and receiver aircraft.Accurately modeling the aerodynamics of these components is a necessary first step toward a successful simulation environment.As a step toward enhancing the aircrew training simulations Corvid Innovation proposes a unique, innovative, and simple toolset for building aircraft aerodynamics models.Leveraging well established practices at Corvid, high-fidelity computational fluid dynamics, in-house HPC systems, and in-house aerodynamic model development tools Corvid will provide an incremental advance in our current methodologies that will enable the proper characterization of a receiver aircraft in the presence of a tanker wake.Tanker aerodynamics and wake generation will also be demonstrated along with drogue response.These aeromodels will be demonstrated through the use of fast-running simulation tools which will serve as a first step in the development of a simulation environment for aircrew training.; BENEFIT: There are a number of paths for commercializing a high-fidelity, fast-running, capability for predicting aircraft response in a dynamic flowfield.The most notable include:1. Formation Flight2. Aerial UAV Refueling (private sector)3. Small UAV Refueling4. Small UAV Gust Response5. Enhanced Aircraft Spacing ProtocolsThe commonality in each of these examples is a need to accurately model the effects of flowfield disturbances. The methodologies established throughout the Phase I and II efforts will be directly applicable in improving the industries capability of i) predicting aircraft responses in a simulated operational environment and ii) improving control algorithms for aircraft under a complex spatially varying flowfield.

award_title: EPIC:Evolvable PED Integrated Cockpit
research_keywords: Intelligence Surveillance Reconnaissance (FMV),Full Motion Video (FMV). Processing Exploitation and Dissemination (PED),Cockpit,Human Factors,Unmanned Aerial Vehicle (UAV),Agile Work Environment (AWE)
abstract: ABSTRACT: The Design Knowledge Company (TDKC) presents this Phase I Small Business Innovation Research (SBIR) proposal titled Evolvable PED Integrated Cockpit (EPIC).Our EPIC solution builds on 1) TDKCs Agile Work Environment (AWE) technology as a rapid prototyping environment; 2) our strong background in Cognitive Task Analysis (CTA); 3) TDKCs Local/Distributed Operational Collaborative User-Centered Support System (LOCUS) to support plug and play multimodal collaboration; and 4) our AOC System Engineering Toolkit (ASET) technology that automates the collection of usability data.EPIC includes an innovative interaction clustering technique that uses Recombinant (data) Structure-Function Chaining (RSFC) to integrate human-machine interface devices or capabilities, data, filters, automations, semantic processing, and image processing techniques to develop novel workflows that improve analyst efficiency and effectiveness to create workflow modules for the EPIC POD. EPIC includes an innovative human-centric cockpit that will augment analysis and enable rapid prototyping and human performance assessment.; BENEFIT: EPIC provides a technology that allows an operator conducting defensive cyber operations to work with many different cyber tools at once, reducing the workload and improving accuracy.This has numerous government, military, and intelligence community customers not to mention commercial customers.There are significant commercial applications in the defense and security domains.

award_title: A PEA IN A POD
research_keywords: Immersive multimodal workspace,Human-Machine Interaction,context-driven user interface,PED,ISR,FMV
abstract: ABSTRACT: While the ability to collect larger volumes of full-motion video (FMV) data grows, analysts within the ISR community struggle to keep pace with the volume, speed, and variety of collection. During Phase 1 Processing, Exploitation, and Dissemination (PED), analysts are required to collaborate with a distributed team of sensor operators, collection and mission managers, and other analysts while navigating and interpreting mounds of data across many disparate sources to produce actionable decisions. Given the pace of these data-intensive workflows, analysts frequently encounter a problem of information management, ranging from the coordination challenges associated with maintaining situational awareness and contextual knowledge while exploiting data across sensor types to identify potential targets, to retrieving, processing, and utilizing sensor data in a timely manner once collected. To address this need, Aptima proposes to develop the Adaptive Personalized Environment for Artificial Intelligence and Naturalistic Applications for PED Operational Domain (A PEA IN A POD). When fully implemented, A PEA IN A PODs advanced multimodal human-machine interfaces and interactions for Phase 1 PED of FMV data will improve information management and interaction between FMV analysts and the technologies they use, therefore creating efficiencies while reducing manpower requirements to support a wide range of ISR missions.; BENEFIT: A PEA IN A POD utilizes emerging technologies, such as immersive visualization, multimodal user interfaces, gesture tracking, speech recognition, and multi-touch, to help FMV analysts accomplish data-intensive PED tasks more quickly and effectively. Benefits include:Combining human analytical reasoning and the human visual system with the latest computational tools for analyzing, displaying, and interaction with information;The ability for users to contextualize and interpret sensor and information feeds in real-time via a more naturalistic, embodied experience;Increased analytic capacity and decreased cognitive load by using strategies for managing multimodal interactions in support of the analysts specific tasking;Increased situation awareness and reduced overall workload via context-driven user interfaces and interactions designed for ISR analysis tasks;Commercialization potential within the defense, homeland security, intelligence community, and healthcare markets.

award_title: Human-computer Environment for Advanced PED (HEAP)
research_keywords: Full Motion Video,Human-computer interaction,human-in-the-loop,Interaction Technologies,Image processing,Mixed Initiative,Ontology based Integration,Processing Exploitation Dissemination
abstract: ABSTRACT: FMV collection presents a challenge to the Air Force Special Operation Command (AFSOC), charged with the processing, exploitation, and dissemination (PED) of raw motion imagery to create meaningful intelligence for the warfighter.In order to overcome this challenge, AFSOC operators must be provided with robust human-centered tools and technologies to rapidly, efficiently, and effectively execute FMV PED.Knowledge Based Systems, Inc. (KBSI), along with their research partner PatchPlus, propose to design, assemble and demonstrate an innovative Human-computer Environment for Advanced PED (HEAP) Framework. HEAP is a suite of mixed initiative tools in an extensible framework that supports the use of intuitive human-machine interaction (HMI) technologies, collaboration tools, and anticipatory FMV analysis features to advance the PED paradigm for robust human-machine teaming.HEAP will contain interface abstractions that allow for new input paradigms such as Human Gesture Control, Human Eye Control, and Voice Recognition that will revolutionize FMV PED by increasing efficiency and reducing manpower requirements.Additionally, HEAP will allow the PED system to monitor the human and generate anticipatory actions, alerts, or UI reconfigurations based on human affective state, behaviors, and the task at hand.As a result, PED operators will perform more efficiently in the complex FMV PED environment.; BENEFIT: HEAP provides several benefits to the warfighter including (i) increased human-machine team efficiency using mixed initiative FMV PED capabilities, (ii) reduced manpower requirements by using state-of-the-art interaction technologies to execute tasks more effectively than with a keyboard and mouse, (iii) reductions in human workload by repetitive task reduction, human-centered UI adaptations, and alerts to reduce human operator workload, (iv) rapid integration of new and innovative FMV PED capacities to support the future of FMV PED operations, and (v) improved efficiencies in reporting and product generation due to rapid FMV analysis and intelligence collection.In the short term, the HEAP Framework will facilitate data sensemaking for FMV PED analysts in the intelligence communities of the DoD.Our sponsors from the Human Effectiveness Directorate of AFRL value from a human-centered FMV PED framework that can be tested, verified, and validated in a laboratory setting as well as extended to meet their internal application requirements.Additionally, in the long term, commercial entities in various domains will benefit from not only an ability to quickly identify and analyze video threats, but also a societal advancement to the state-of-the-art of motion video analysis and interaction.The market segment for motion video tools which reduces future investments and improve operations is enormous and we plan to exploit this segment using our intelligence domain skills, intelligence SME input, and unique access to potential end-users.

award_title: Modeling Framework for Automated Aircraft Escape Injury Risk Assessment
research_keywords: Aircraft ejection,biodynamics,FINITE ELEMENT MODELING,F-35,spinal injury,injury assessment
abstract: ABSTRACT: ATA Engineering, Inc. (ATA), partnered with L-3 Applied Technologies Inc. (L-3 ATI), proposes the development of configurable models, a simulation framework,and a software interface that will augment biodynamic experiments to provide stakeholders with a screening tool to quickly evaluate injury likelihood given a set of ejection system and occupant parameters. The effort will leverage decades of company experience performing advanced finite element (FE) simulations to create a configurable model of the F-35 ejection equipment (seat, guide rails, cushion, restraints, and flight gear) and methods for applying the governing forces (ejection, gravitational, aerodynamic [windblast], and parachute [drogue and main]) to the model. Using the commercial analysis software LS-DYNA, the component mechanical finite element models (MFEMs) will be coupled with an existing human finite element model (HFEM) developed by L-3 ATI to enable rapid assessment of injury probability and severity. In Phase I, the project team will demonstrate feasibility by creating a functional user interface mockup, integrating mechanical and biodynamic models, executing a simulation of a test rig acceleration event, and comparing the predicted response to measured ATD data. Phase II will involve model refinement, flight load modeling,and preliminary validation using measurements from rocket sled testing of the F-35 seat.; BENEFIT: Including the U.S. Air Force and Navy, F-35 fleets will soon become part of at least thirteen international forces. While component commonality across all F-35 variants (A, B, and C) promises to achieve efficiencies in procurement and sustainment, the aircraft will ultimately fulfill vastly different roles for each operator. In addition, the flight suit equipment, restraints, helmet configuration, and even average pilot sizeall critical factors in injury riskwill undoubtedly vary across these operators, even as the US16E ejection seatremains common. While rocket sled testing will provide some in situ measurement of the loads imparted on the occupant, it will not account for human responses (e.g., pre-ejection bracing) and will only be performed for a small subset of conditions. As a result, the proposed tool will be critical for giving stakeholders responsible for ensuring pilot safety, including Martin-Baker and AFRLs Human Effectiveness DirectorateApplied Neuroscience Branch (RHCP), a means for comprehensively evaluating injury risk across a wide parameter space of equipment and escape condition permutations. As the F-35 ejection system and pilot equipment continue to evolve, ensuring pilot safety will be of paramount importance to the Joint Program Office (JPO). The tool will also aid escape injury assessment for future aircraft, such as the Long-Range Strike Bomber and Trainer-X (T-X), which will have unique flight envelopes.

award_title: Global-Local Modeling of Aircraft Occupant Safety Assessment during Ejection
research_keywords: FEM,GUI,spinal injury,F-35 seat,Aircraft ejection,human response
abstract: ABSTRACT: The extreme ejection conditions in the fifth-generation fighter F-35 could lead to occupant injury. Rocket sled testing of ejection seat with manikins is limited in simulating human response. The current neck injury models and injury criteria from automotive safety are inadequate for the ejection-related injury. We propose to develop the global-to-local finite element models (FEM) and simulation environment to enable fast, accurate simulation of occupant ejection, injury estimation and safety assessment. A fast-running global FEM is performed to establish the biodynamics of restrained occupant under ejection and windblast loadings and to identify critical areas i.e. cervical spine. The local FEM analyzes the spinal injury biomechanics, in which the global FEM provides appropriate boundary conditions. In Phase I we will design the simulation framework for occupants with different sizes in the ejection seat. The biodynamic response of global FEM will be validated against test and simulation data (ATB, Easy5). The detailed FEM of cervical-thoracic-lumbar-pelvis complex will be used to identify the critical variables in the ejection seat that contribute to soft tissue injury and vertebral fracture. A GUI framework will be established to facilitate modeling and simulations of occupant ejection. In Phase II, the FE models and GUI will be improved.; BENEFIT: The developed global-local FE modeling and the simulation environment will provide a new analysis tool for evaluation of ejection-related injury and safety improvement of ejection seat. The main benefit to the pilot is the faster development of better protection with improved survivability in ejection event. The models and software will be available to DoD and DoD prime contractors in open source format. The model development has great applicability to other DoD agencies in the field of ejection safety system. In Phase III, CFDRC plans to work with DOD and private manufacturers to help analyze and improve their ejection seat designs.

award_title: GEMINI: Gestalt Mixed-Initiative Intelligence
research_keywords: Information Fusion,shared understanding,human-machine team,intelligence analysis,goal-directed autonomy,adaptive interfaces
abstract: ABSTRACT: SIFT proposes to build GEMINI (Gestalt Mixed-Initiative Intelligence), a shared workspace where humans and machines collaboratively assemble intelligence products. In a human-machine team, the collaborators have vastly different-- albeit complementary-- cognitive capabilities. Thus, a central research challenge is to expressively and soundly translate from analyst-centric interfaces (for human understanding and high-level fusion) into structured knowledge and goals (for goal-directed autonomy) and back again for intuitive support. The analyst will use an intuitive user interface (UI) to fuse information and define objectives. GEMINI will decode the UI's elements into structured information and decomposable goals, and then assign goals to specialized agents-- such as graph-matchers, document retrievers, information extractors, and image processors-- to augment the analysts workflow. It will scan agent-generated information for relevance to the analysts objectives and focus, and then present relevant information within intuitive displays using Adaptive Interface Management (AIM) technology. Having pioneered work on AIM, goal- and task-based autonomy, information extraction, and data fusion, SIFT is well-positioned to build and transition GEMINI to customers that need it. By facilitating the bi-directional human-machine information flow and leveraging both parties' innate strengths, GEMINI will enable human-machine teams to identify threats and insights faster and more accurately than ever before.; BENEFIT: By facilitating the bi-directional human-machine information flow and leveraging both parties' innate strengths, GEMINI will enable human-machine teams to identify threats and insights faster and more accurately than ever before.GEMINI's integration of goal-directed autonomy in an analyst-centric fusion setting will yield synergistic benefits for the human and for the autonomous agents: the analyst receives mission-relevant information in intuitive interfaces to support high-level information fusion; the agents receive the analyst's hypotheses, context, objectives, and high-level fused information to support goal-directed automation.GEMINI consequently has the commercially-viable feature of reducing the time and technical expertise that an organization requires to remain competitive.The extensibility of GEMINI's analyst interface-- including displays for monitoring and control-- and of GEMINI's autonomy manager-- including a goal- and knowledge-based interface for agent metacontrol-- will reduce the cost and effort of extending GEMINI to additional customers with novel information needs.This facilitates integration of diverse autonomous agents toward common objectives, as we will demonstrate in our Phase I effort.Ultimately, GEMINI's extensibility will help it generalize to strategic intelligence, tactical intelligence, and other human information fusion settings.

award_title: Information Fusion to Enable Shared Perception between Humans and Machines via Fused Realities Adaptive Modules (FRAM)
research_keywords: Information Fusion,Autonomy,human-machine teams,interface design,high-level information fusion,Data Fusion
abstract: ABSTRACT: Fused Informational Realities (FIR) module provides new levels and types of Information Fusion to Enable Shared Perception between Humans and Machines. Innovatively FIR exploits our semi-transparent superimposition fusion methods to enhance human Intel analysts perceptions, encoding, intuitive associations, and interpreting of the machine integrated information to make decisions. We have validated FIR increased effectiveness and efficiencies at the most basic levels, by significantly reducing eye-saccades (eye-movements) during which the human perceptual system is blind; along with cognitive benefits as task-time reductions, and error-reduction advantages derived from reduced cognitive context-switching currently required during frequent, repeated, time-wasting, error-prone switching between the primary work area display and secondary Graphical User Interfaces multiple menus/modes/controls and separate-viewers. FIR further enables Intel Analysts beneficial focus, controlling, and inputting within the primary work area display via user selectable modular options for our Touch&Speak, Gesture&Speak, and/or Look&Speak again eliminating unnecessary traditional GUI interactions. These three innovations also automate intuitive selecting and placing 2525B Icons/Graphics, Annotations, Intel Hyperlinks, etc. FIRs IntelliMarks (Intelligent-Bookmarks) software modules enabling analysts to intuitively annotate/highlight, and effectively share objects/events of interest within ANY COTS/GOTS viewers of Intel content, and/or ANY displayed content. FIR Software-Development-Kit encapsulates/enables design-teams to implement our scientifically justifiable methods/guidance for improved design; BENEFIT: Our Fused Informational Realities (FIR modules are designed to be added onto existing Intel analysts workstations as well as manned and unmanned aircraft systems.Our modular add-on approach enables defense and/or commercial interface design teams to improve human-machine teams ability to fuse information.We envision new levels and types of shared human-machine teams understanding with faster more effective military results, for human-autonomous machine teams.Our team has already developed an integrated suite of scientific assessment tools designed to objectively assess combined human and system performance.Our suite has already been used to objectively assess two different GOTS common robotic controllers on military relevant tasks, to support a transition customers down-select. These tools provide a differential advantage to our team, and will be delivered as an essential part of our end-to-end solution for this Air Force project.We anticipate near-term operational uses by early adopters based upon successes we have already achieved in unmanned systems (unmanned aerial systems, unmanned ground vehicles, and networks of unattended sensors).Specifically, we have modularly enhanced existing government off the shelf common robotic controllers with our FIR innovations, our own next generation interfaces (see www.MirrorTrainingInc.com for our Wear Your Robot breakthroughs and press coverage) including successful scientific studies with military subjects and university students demonstrating benefits.Additional Intel analysts use cases, plus survival, lethality, and aircraft operational fusion and shared perception exemplars are included in the non-public document areas of this document.

award_title: Inexpensive Haptic Devices and 3D Medical Game for the Interosseous Infusion Procedure
research_keywords: Medical haptics,training games,haptic devices,intraosseous insertion
abstract: ABSTRACT: For this Phase I project, we propose to develop an intraosseous infusion (IO) training simulator that consists of an off-the-shelf uninstrumented partial manikin, a low-cost haptic display, and an augmented reality (AR) display. Phase I will focus on establishing learning objectives and evaluation criteria; establishing criteria for adapting a 3D game for use with inexpensive haptic device; developing mathematical models of the anatomy and penetration; designing a prototype low-cost haptic device; and planning the integration of models, haptic device, and manikin. These objectives are structured to provide a firm foundation for evaluating, refining, and manufacturing the prototype, creating training scenarios, and preparing for commercialization. The first version of the IO trainer will be a comprehensive AR/VR sternal insertion unit with haptic capabilities using the FAST1 device, comprehensive metrics and no disposables.; BENEFIT: Lack of a cost-effective and widely deployable IO training device has resulted in limiting use of this lifesaving technology to trained combat medics and paramedics. This research aims to expand the reach of this procedure by creating an AR/VR IO trainer with no consumable parts that may be used to replace the current live tissue training (LTT) model. This will greatly reduce the total lifecycle cost of training for this device, make it possible to train in and beyond the schoolhouse, and make the IO procedure more widely available.

award_title: Inexpensive Haptic Devices and 3D Medical Game for the Interosseous Infusion Procedure
research_keywords: Medical haptics,serious games,training games,haptic devices
abstract: ABSTRACT: ArchieMD proposes to integrate visual 3-D computer models, with a game engine, and haptics provide an immersive training environment for intraosseous infusion procedures. This SBIR project will demonstrate proof of concept of this revolutionary new teaching model.This system will include state of the art medically correct and realistic interactive visualization of patients at multiple levels (whole patient, organ systems, individual organs, etc.) and haptic devices to providetactile feedback. The proposed system will enable trainees to develop visual representations of intraosseous infusionprocedures with simulated human hands manipulating instruments on a lifelike computer generatedpatient model, that corresponds to their actions through the integration of haptic devices.Optional superimposed internal anatomy, visualized during the procedure reinforces the identification of critical external anatomical landmarks and illustrates the proper guidance of instruments within the body.; BENEFIT: Transition the model through widespread commercialization and government acquisition. Deliver the final product for the government and private sector market. Applications should be ready military schoolhouses, training communities, and the commercial sector.

award_title: Cognition Biomarker Measurement in Sweat as an Index of Human Performance
research_keywords: Dehydration,Cognition,biomarker,Sweat,Human Performance,Sensor
abstract: ABSTRACT: Warfighters are exposed to many forms of significant stress both sporadically throughout the day and accumulating across long periods of time, which can affect human performance and operational effectiveness. Perhaps often overlooked are the impacts of dehydration on cognitive performance, as even mild dehydration impairs performance related to attention, psychomotor, and immediate memory, all of which are critical functions to the warfighter operating in any environment. Continuous, real-time, quantitative monitoring of dehydration connected to cognitive function would be invaluable to mitigation and management strategies of at-risk warfighters and human operators.To be truly useful to the warfighter, dehydration monitoring would require real-time, non-invasive measurement of definitive dehydration biomarkers shown to correlate with cognitive impairment, a feat yet to be commercially realized. Eccrine Systems proposes analyzing human sweat samples from an ongoing dehydration-cognition study to, for the first time, correlate biomarkers in sweat to dehydration-induced cognitive impairment and develop a dehydration-cognition algorithm. Having proven the feasibility of the approach, will build on its Sweatronics Platform to design a system for monitoring, noninvasively and in real-time, and reporting dehydration status and its cognitive impact as part of a user dashboard relating cognitive state information to the warfighter and related users and systems.; BENEFIT: The creation of a real-time, objective monitoring system to manage the impact of dehydration on cognitive function will have broad impact on airmen, improving situation awareness, decision-making, mission planning, and overall airman task performance. Additionally, broad commercial applications for a wearable dehydration-monitoring device exist in professional athletics, industrial workforce, personal health, and medical applications. Correlating dehydration-monitoring to cognitive function expands these markets, and greatly increases their value proposition. Combined, even with modest adoption levels, these applications represent a multi-billion dollar market opportunity.

award_title: Cognitive Sweat Biomarker Array
research_keywords: Sweat,biomarker,biomarker detection,ion detection,Metabolite,Fatigue,cognitive
abstract: ABSTRACT: Ionterra Sciences proposes to develop a multiplexed fatigue status detection system utilizing sweat as the diagnostic fluid the based on ion detection through anchored biomolecular complexes. A compact, fatigue monitoring device with the 1) sensitivity to identify low concentrations of biomarkers; 2) simplicity of a fitness monitor, 3) robustness of microarray diagnostics 4) use of non-invasive sweat based biomarkers would fulfill the needs of field fatigue identification system and provide numerous logistical benefits to armed forces, and the civilian sector where life-critical decisions are made.A multiplexed device with the simplicity of a fitness monitor that is capable of detecting fatigue early and transmitting the data will provide a solution that mitigates increased risk factors faced by fatigued Warfighters.; BENEFIT: A wide range of stressors puts pilots and Warfighters at risk for psychological trauma and medical difficulties ranging from problems of memory and cognition, substance abuse, and decreased task performance, and fatigue.Unfortunately, mental performance directly translates to mission accomplishment and safety. As people become fatigued there is a substantial increase in the frequency with which longer than usual reaction times occur. Consequently, in military operations greater than 70% of all catastrophic mishaps are caused by human error. Since the research literature and common experience tells us that fatigue and stressors can affect decision-making and performance on the training and battle field, it is imperative that command is capable of detecting fatigue and modifying plans based on Warfighter conditions.Using this information intelligently can result in fewer lives lost and equipment damage.

award_title: Microdosimetry of High Amplitude Ultrashort RF and Electric Fields
research_keywords: pulsed electric field,bioelectric effects,cancer therapy,nanoporation,cell apoptosis
abstract: ABSTRACT: In recent years, there has been increasing use of time-varying electric fields to manipulate the behavior of biological cells. The application of large electric fields (>105 V/cm) with nanosecond pulse widths has been observed to produce effects that include long-term polarization of the cells plasma membrane, electrodeformation, and increased uptake of nanoparticles, indicating promise for effective treatment of cancer. Researchers using nsPEF techniques increasingly need to accurately measure the specific temporal, spatial, and amplitude characteristics of the applied field.The dielectric response of the extracellular fluid, the cell geometry, and the physical dimensions of the electrodes all have an impact on the ultimate electric field strength experienced by the cell. To address this need, Nanohmics proposes to develop the Electric Field Measurement Array (EFMA), which will provide electric field measurements with sub-nanosecond temporal response and sub-m spatial resolution.The EFMA can be used directly as a horizontal platform for biological cell experiments, or as part of a standard electroporation cuvette. The EFMA can provide electric field strength and coarse direction with sufficient resolution in time and space to completely characterize the electric field exposure of a single cell from a single nsPEF event.; BENEFIT: EFMA technologys first application will be to provide measuring instrumentation to scientists and engineers who are involved in measuring the spatial and temporal characteristics of electric fields. With EFMA instrumentation, researchers will be able to make better measurements of the physical electric field phenomena that influence the behavior and response of biological cells.

award_title: Granphene Scanning Resonance Microscope
research_keywords: Graphene,microscope,Resonators,ribbons,nanoscience,Biometric,micro-dosimetry
abstract: ABSTRACT: (*)As neuroscience and bioelectric nodes decrease in size and the density of observation requirements increases the ability to rapidly image (< 1400 minutes) large areas ~ 1 cm2 while maintaining high resolution ~ 1-2 nm of the surface under test (SUT) to support biological systems isolation operations is very much going to involve radically innovative approaches that will use nanotechnology itself namely using atoms to see other atoms.Traditional electron, AFM, and photon optics, seems wholly inadequate for the task and has emerged as a real impending bottleneck either in terms of image acquisition speed or meeting the resolution and reliability targets of future technology nodes.Measuring and analysis at the cellular and inner cellular level will require a complete rethinking of the methods and application of measurement science to identify, diagnose and verify treatment.Incremental improvements of existing methods will be inadequate.Digibeam Corporation is proposing a feasibility study to develop a Graphene Resonance Surface Microscope (GRSM) alpha tool with a capability for non-contact imaging ~ 1 cm2 area of a biological systems with better than 3 nm lateral resolution and ~ 0.5 nm depth resolution in under 4 hours.; BENEFIT: A high speed, high resolution microscope, monitoring system

award_title: Human-Activity Sensor Returns
research_keywords: synthetic,multimodal,sensor,human,Simulation,Radar,lidar,Hyperspectral
abstract: ABSTRACT: To address the Air Forces need for software-synthesized multimodal sensor returns to explore data fusion for human-based activities, Physical Optics Corporation (POC) proposes to develop a new Human-Activity Sensor Returns (HASR) modeling software library and simulation framework. It integrates human, environment, and sensor models with physical effects modeling to generate scientifically rigorous synthetic sensor returns. Specifically, the innovation in synchronized simulation of multimodal sensors (e.g., radar, SAR, LIDAR, and hyperspectral) with a single input dataset representing the environment and human activities, will produce synthetic multimodal sensor return data that is consistent across modalities, and high fidelity in human-focused scenarios. With an architecture that scales easily with sensor and environmental model additions, HASR is the first solution for comprehensive and integrated high-fidelity modeling of human activities across multiple sensor modalities, which directly addresses the Air Force need for multimodal human-activity imagery baselines. In Phase I, POC will demonstrate the feasibility of HASR by surveying mathematical sensor and environmental models, developing an end-to-end systems architecture, and demonstrating a preliminary proof-of-concept system. In Phase II, POC plans to develop and demonstrate a functional prototype with a graphical user interface and multimodal capabilities.; BENEFIT: Current imagery baselines for radar, SAR, LIDAR, and hyperspectral sensors were developed independently, without a common 3D scene baseline, and without a focus on human-based activity. These limitations prevent their use for the direct comparison of sensor results in general (due to disparate 3D scenes), and prevent the application of the current imagery baselines to human-based activities. HASR applies a unified 3D scene to every sensor so sensor results can be compared directly, and adds a focus on human activities that will enable those sensor results to be applied to human activities such as walking, running, digging, and throwing. HASR is the first tool that can produce appropriate imagery baselines for evaluation of new sensors, sensor technologies, surveillance monitors, crowd monitors, and reconnaissance technologies in both military and commercial worlds. For example, HASR sensor data could be used to select an optimal sensor(s) and sensor processing technologies for monitoring of neutral civilians with embedded covert agents, for automated surveillance of crowds around military bases. In the commercial world, HASR could be applied to surveillance systems for homes and businesses, to improve automatic detection of potentially covert activities (e.g., mine burial and bomb throwing) while minimizing generation of false alarms from similar benign activities (e.g., gardening and waving).

award_title: Multi-modal Synthetic Sensor Data Generator with Real-World Environmental Effects and Sensor Physics
research_keywords: sensor fusion,MODELING AND SIMULATION,Synthetic Data,Radar,lidar,Infrared,Hyperspectral,Full Motion Video
abstract: ABSTRACT: There is a need to develop a sufficient-fidelity simulation tool to create multi-sensor datasets for human activity detection and recognition. To address this need, Intelligent Automation Inc. (IAI) and Infoscitex Corporation (IST) propose a novel, integrated, sufficient-fidelity simulation tool called HumanView (HumV). The proposed software will leverage existing tools, integrate commercial, proprietary and COTS multi-physics simulation tools and material properties databases. The key elements of the proposed architecture are: The HumV Models module will be a data store that will contain 3D human models, 3D geometric models of environment, relevant sensor models (RF, LIDAR and Hyperspectral) and platform models (UAV, aircraft) on which the sensors reside. The HumV editor module will allow researchers to discover the available models, manage the configuration associated with a model using a drag-n-drop interface, and create specific activities for the model, and associate mathematical models where appropriate. The HumV simulator module will allow the user to simulate multiple scenarios that will generate the synthetic sensor data for analytics. The goal of the Phase I program is to demonstrate the feasibility of HumV.Specific focus areas will include developing the overall architecture, and developing key HumV components.; BENEFIT: Development of HumV will allow the military to generate realistic and physically sound sensor imagery data from virtual 3D scenes, expanding capabilities of ISR applications. The technology would also be useful in other arenas such as analytical technology development for homeland security applications. HumV would be beneficial to developers of first responder support equipment for operations such as search and rescue.Commercial application of HumV include the fast growing field of robotics. Just as LIDAR simulators are used by roboticists today to test their algorithms, HumV may be used by developers of self-driving cars (which use a variety of sensors) and any other Artificial Intelligence or robotic systems that interact with humans, enabling the development of algorithms for navigating in human environments.

award_title: Safe and Intelligent Surveying of Complex Environments with UAS Swarms
research_keywords: UAV,swarm,path-planning,wind models,Sensors,safety analysis
abstract: Barron Associates proposes development of the micro-Swarm Environmental Sensing (SENS) technology to safely and efficiently gather high spatiotemporal resolution wind data to initialize diagnostic wind models. SENS includes UAV platforms instrumented with meteorological sensors and swarm / path planning software to coordinate behaviors amongst multiple vehicles. SENS fills an important need in modeling wind flow through urban environments. Accurate diagnostic tools serve a critical role in many military, civilian, and home defense applications. Micro-scale diagnostic models fill an important operation need as they have low computational requirements and can execute on hand-held devices making them an invaluable asset for field and mobile operations. Studies have shown that accurate initialization data increases the accuracy of such models, particularly in urban environments and complex terrain. The evaluation and the improvement of urban flow models rely on the observations of flows and turbulence from flows near ground level to the RSL at high spatiotemporal resolution. Swarms of UAVs developed with SENS technology have the potential to capture these observations, and will be instructed to target information-rich areas. These areas consist, for example, of areas with large spatial gradients in wind shear and temperature that are important in generating or destructing turbulence kinetic energy.

award_title: Microcosm Forecasting Utilizing Swarm Unmanned Aerial Vehicle Technology
research_keywords: Wind Field,Transport and Dispersion Modeling
abstract: Toyon proposes to develop the Microscale Wind Field Measurement System (MWFMS) for measuring a full 3D wind field by using a approach capable of measuring the wind velocity and direction throughout an entire volume. The proposed approach uses a micro UAV equipped with local meteorological sensor in conjunction with a mathematical model. The wind field is then estimating using specialized data processing and computational methods and current measurements. The approach promises to create a fast and manageable solution for covering the 3DWF grid volume. The proposed solution also leverages several Toyon technologies for UAV routing, navigation and control, decentralized asset management for a swarm of micro UAV's, and domain knowledge in the area transport and dispersion modeling. The Phase I research will assess the feasibility of the MWFMS solution through a combination of performance modeling and proof-of-principle testing.

award_title: WeatherHive: Distributed Swarm Microcosm Wind Forecasting using NanoUAVs
research_keywords: Nano-UAV,drone swarm,WeatherHive
abstract: A mortar team positions itself on an urban battlefield. Theyre tasked to support operators in the urban landscape. Unknown wind conditions and the probability of civilian casualties complicate the mission. An Army engineer pulls a 20 pound canister from his teams MRAP, sets it in the middle of a dirt road. He unscrews the top and starts an app on his ATAK tablet. The desired wind field measurement area was pre-programmed into the app during mission planning, so he merely presses the launch button. 120 quadcopter nano-drones stream out of the canister four at a time, each weighing 50 grams, and measuring 5 inches across. During the next ten minutes, the nano-drone swarm measures wind intensity in the specified area. They downlink data to the app via a mesh network. During the flight, the engineer unfurls a funnel shaped fixture and places it atop the canister. Upon mission completion, the vehicles return to the canister through the funnel. Quickly they are stacked back into the launch canister. The vehicles recharge and are ready to fly again in 20 minutes. This is the WeatherHive nano-UAV swarm, developed by GreenSight Agronomics teamed with the NASA Jet Propulsion Laboratorys Swarm Research Group.

award_title: Airborne Network using Spectrum-Efficient Communications Technologies (ANSECT)
research_keywords: MIMO,Multi-Input Multi-Output,Airborne communications,spectrum efficient,spectrum efficiency,Test and Evaluation,spectrum agility,agile spectrum
abstract: Oceanit proposes to develop MIMO-based high spectrum efficient technologies for airborne battle-space communications.

award_title: Airborne Multi-antenna Robust Collaborative Network (AMRCN)
research_keywords: MIMO,Multi-User,interference alignment,Multi-cast,MANET,airborne,Backbone,Gateway
abstract: Airborne networks provide the ideal backbone alternative to legacy ground infrastructure and SATCOM for providing C2 and other communication to forward operating units. Airborne networks offer reliable coverage, fast deployment, survivability, low installation cost, among many other advantages.When compared with legacy point-to-point airborne links and mobile ad-hoc terrestrial network, however, airborne networks present significantly tougher technical challenges ranging from wireless channel types to node dynamics and susceptibility to interference. Furthermore, airborne networks with next generation capabilities must exhibit superior spectrum efficiency to support as many users in the battlefield with minimal available spectrum.In this effort we look at taking full advantage of multi-antenna techniques across the entire network stack to achieve several multiplicative factors in spectrum efficiency. We combine the well known physical layer spatial multiplexing MIMO with new higher layer features such as network MIMO, multi-user MIMO, and MIMO-aware multi-cast routing in a low-SWaP low-cost portable radio form factor. Such higher layer features require sophisticated collaboration protocols between network nodes.In addition to spectrum efficiency, the airborne network will include mature technological features such as MIMO radio interference mitigation, dynamic spectrum access, link adaptation, among others to deliver on a complete, robust solution.

award_title: Cognitive Airborne Communications with RF Interference Mitigation and Anti-jam Capabilities (RIMA)
research_keywords: RF interference mitigation (RIM) and anti-jam (RIMA),interference cancellation,null-steering antenna,BEAMFORMING,reliable communications,spectrum efficiency,Cognitive Radio,wideband communications
abstract: The airborne tier of our militarys communications network plays a critical role in enabling real-time situational awareness, allowing warfighters to synchronize their operations both on and off the battlefield. As the number of users sharing broadband data grows, new technologies are required to mitigate radio frequency (RF) interference for airborne relays and network subscribers. A robust and unified solution must include subsystems that address detection and mitigation of interference at every tier of the protocol stack.As the final element in the RF transmit chain and the first element in the RF receive chain, the antenna plays a critical role in establishing the sensitivity of an RF transceiver. By incorporating hardware-level interference mitigation, the antenna is uniquely capable of protecting the transceiver against high-power interference while also preserving its ability to operate over its entire operational spectrum. For this reason, interference-mitigation techniques implemented in the physical (PHY) layer of the protocol stack are an especially important piece of a robust solution to minimize both cosite and off-platform sources of interference.During Phase I, FIRST RF will demonstrate the practical capabilities of hardware-based interference mitigation systems and explore adapting this approach to provide a universal RF interference-mitigation and anti-jam (RIMA) solution.

award_title: Cognitive Airborne Communications with RF Interference Mitigation and Anti-jam Capabilities (RIMA)
research_keywords: Cognitive Radio,Interference Mitigation,jamming mitigation,adaptive mitigation,threat characterization,Airborne networks,ICeAIR
abstract: Welkin Sciences is proposing areal-time, fully adaptive mitigation approach to counter the effects of received interference and jamming on airborne communication links. The proposed approach, entitled ICeAIR (Independent of Component Analysis for Interference Removal), includes an adaptive method for separating the desired communication signal form sources of jamming and interference with no prior description of the jamming/interference sources.In addition, the proposed method includes detection and classification methods to aid in identifying and characterizing the threat signal source.

award_title: Cloud Aerial Layer Management
research_keywords: airborne,cloud,Aerial layer,network management,AUTONOMOUS
abstract: To address the Air Force need for a managed aerial layer network employing cloud capabilities, Physical Optics Corporation (POC) proposes to develop a new Cloud Aerial Layer Management (CALM) cloud architecture. This new architecture leverages and enhances commercial/Government off-the-shelf (COTS/GOTS) cloud components and delay-tolerant networking (DTN). Specifically, the innovation in cloud/network architecture enhancements will enable the aerial layer cloud to offer resources to ground, air, and space nodes in a challenging aerial environment. Connectivity and resources (e.g., storage, virtual servers, and system management) are reliably provided from resource pools with redundancy despite changing network connectivity due to node mobility, jamming, and electromagnetic pulse (EMP) attack, and loss of SATCOM and terrestrial gateways. These specifications directly address the Air Force requirements for airborne layer network cloud computing with legacy and advanced communication links in interservice, interalliance operations. In Phase I, POC will demonstrate the feasibility of CALM by developing a system architecture, and demonstrating and delivering a laboratory instantiation, at TRL 4/ 5, serving the tactical edge user and other temporary and permanent users. In Phase II, POC plans to construct a demonstration, at TRL-6, of the aerial cloud layer with heterogeneous mobile nodes, multiple networks, and link adversity.

award_title: Robust Tactical Airborne Cloud (RT-ABC)
research_keywords: airborne,Cloud Computing (CC),Distributed Processing,mobile communications,scalable,Aerial Layer Cloud,Joint Aerial Layer Network (JALN),secure
abstract: A cloud computing (CC) application for airborne platforms is proposed that will create and enhance net-enabled combat capability alongside the future Joint Aerial Layer Network. The architecture will be dynamic and permit airborne, space-based, and terres

award_title: Survivable, Secure and Dependable Wireless Communications
research_keywords: NC3,HICS,WSC2,anti-jam,LPI,LPD,LPE
abstract: The aging Hardened Intersite Cable System (HICS) provides the backbone for communications within a Missile Wing. HICS allows every Launch Control Center (LCC) to securely command, control, and monitor every Launch Facility (LF) in its squadron. This program seeks to modernize intra-squadron communications with a wireless Weapon System Command and Control (WSC2) capability. A wireless WSC2 system would not face the same sustainment issues as HICS (e.g., damaged cable repair) and would provide secure LCC/LF-to-vehicle and vehicle-to-vehicle communications.WPL has extensive experience supporting the development, integration, and sustainment of Nuclear Command, Control, and Communications (NC3) technology. One of our engineers served as an Air Force NC3 Lead Command Manager from 2010 to 2015; another was requested by name to advise the Air Force Nuclear Weapons Center's NC3 Sustainment Integration Assessment Team.In Phase I, WPL will perform a technology feasibility assessment to identify a communications architecture that conforms to the requirements and constraints imposed by the NC3 application. Preliminary designs for the physical, data link, and network layers of our architecture will also be developed in Phase I. WPL has identified Lockheed Martin as a Phase III transition partner; we will work with Lockheed Martin beginning in Phase I.

award_title: Survivable Covert Communication EMP-Resistant System
research_keywords: LPI,LPD,LPE,Communications,electronic warfare,jam-resistant
abstract: To address the Air Force need for a secure wireless communications system that is survivable and jam-resistant, having low probability of detection, interception, and exploitation (LPD/LPI/LPE), and supports communications with a data rate of at least 1 Mbps over >50 miles, preferably within the 335 to 500 MHz frequency band, Physical Optics Corporation (POC) proposes to develop a new Secure Covert Communication EMI/Radiation Resistant System (SUCCESS). This proposed system is based on the integration of available COTS hardware components/technologies with POCs in-house LPI/LPD/LPE chaotic communication schema to offer secure communication with exceptional LPI/LPD/LPE/anti-jam performance (

award_title: Fusion of Multiple Motion Information Sources
abstract: ns can be generated. Which is sufficient to steer antenna wave for 60 degree. The research team not only has intensive experiences in silicon

award_title: Secure and Survivable Antennas for Communication in a Nuclear Environment
research_keywords: V-Band,Nuclear,W-band,Communications,secure,EMP,survivable,LDI/LPD
abstract: FIRST RF Corporation of Boulder, CO, proposes an in-depth trade study to identify the optimal antenna architecture for each end of a geosynchronous link capable of surviving the first and second order effects of a critical nuclear event.Antennas which enable sufficient protection from radiation for the sensitive active electronics will be considered, with measured results guiding the convergence.

award_title: Secure and Survivable Antennas for Communication in a Nuclear Environment
research_keywords: SATCOM antennas,frequency selective surfaces,dichroic filters,overlapped antenna feed,2-axis gimbals,multiple beam antenna,earth coverage antenna
abstract: Agile RF Systems LLC has proposed a unique solution to realizing a multiple beam antenna (MBA) architecture at V/W band that substantially reduces physical integration complexity. The proposed antenna architecture allows physical separation of transmit and receive feed networks resulting in the requisite isolation for full duplex networks met using a distributed combination of spatial and spectral techniques. Furthermore, the MBA is achieved without requiring multiple full scale antenna deployments to intersperse beams or a highly linearized active beamforming network. The proposed solution enables overlapped feeds to achieve high efficiency operation of the antenna for each spot beam using passive structures. The requisite field of view that enables spot beam relocation is accomplished using an innovative 2-axis mechanism that reduces actuator complexity and increasing system reliability for launch and long life operations in space. The active MMICs baselined greatly simplify the frequency up and down conversion functions in a highly integrated package containing all the required low noise and transmit power amplifiers.

award_title: Modular, Secure and Affordable Design for NextGen ADS-B Integration
research_keywords: ADS-B,transceiver,ADS-B IN,ADS-B OUT,1090-ES,Extended Squitter,Universal Access Transceiver (UAT),ADS-B Link Augmentation
abstract: Automatic Dependent Surveillance-Broadcast (ADS-B) protocol provides significant benefits such as increased air safety and improved air-traffic conflict detection and resolution since it allows other aircrafts in the vicinity to know their relative positions without relying on an infrastructure. Despite the years of work on the development of standards, testing, etc., the ADS-B protocol does not specify mechanisms to ensure that the protocol messages are either authentic or adhere to any security properties. Due to this vulnerability, the ADS-B transmissions can be easily spoofed, modified or hijacked. Thus, the issue of secure transmissions is one of the key aspects of our proposal which makes this opportunity significant for the civil and defense aviation community. In this proposal, we recommend asystem that will assure secure ADS-B transmissions, while being a cost-effective architecture for providing modularity, affordability, and speed of deployment. The proposed architecture for NextGen ADS-B integration does not require any modifications to the ADS-B Transceiver, and thus can be implemented without any delays before the year 2020 mandate set by the FAA and combat authorities.We propose to illustrate a laboratory scale concept of this design and demonstrate its proof-of-concept during Phase I, using ground/air equipment, time and resources permitting.

award_title: Modular, Secure and Affordable Design for NextGen ADS-B Integration
research_keywords: ADS-B,ADS-B security,Automatic Dependent Surveillance Broadcast,multilateration,wireless security,1090 ES,Air traffic control,NextGen
abstract: As part of an ongoing effort to modernize the air traffic control (ATC) system, the FAA is requiring aircraft to become compliant with the Next Generation Air Transportation System (NextGen) doctrine, which adopts new methodology for ATC wireless communications. The NexGen design offers more precise air traffic monitoring at an affordable cost compared to traditional radar-based systems.One of the key requirements of the NextGen transformation is that aircraft support the Automatic Dependent Surveillance-Broadcast (ADS-B) protocol, a wireless protocol for broadcasting position, velocity, identification and other information for reception by ground stations and aircraft. ADS-B does not make use of encryption or authentication which exposes it to spoofing and eavesdropping attacks. These attacks can be conducted from malicious ground stations or aircraft in flight using inexpensive commercial off-the-shelf (COTS) software-defined radio equipment.Using a novel approach described herein, PreTalen proposes a system (Hardened Electronic ADS-B Protection System - HEAPS) that will protect against attempts to send false position or velocity information in ADS-B transmissions. Our algorithms are based on signal characteristics that are unable to be spoofed by sophisticated adversaries. The approach also works on the existing ADS-B protocol and requires no changes to the standard or transmitters.

award_title: Athena: A Multi-INT Data-Driven Indications and Warning (I&amp;W) Tool for Event Recognition in SSA
research_keywords: space situational awareness,Indications and Warning,change detection,Anomaly Detection,Event Recognition,machine learning,Normality Modeling,Data Fusion  Normality Modeling,Data FusionNormality Modeling
abstract: Analysts and operators need to know as soon as possible when their satellites are in danger, so that responses can be initiated to provide tactical protection. Numerica proposes to leverage its advanced prototype software, Athena, to provide timely and reliable indications and warnings (I&Ws) derived from evolving situations by discovering anomalous correlations across events detected using multi-source, multi-INT data. The Athena software prototype currently uses state-of-the-art data-driven unsupervised and semi-supervised machine learning methods for joint normality modeling and anomalous event recognition. It was developed under previous AFRL funding, and validated using real photometric data collected from electro-optical sensors (i.e., light-curve data, an example of measurement and signature intelligence, or MASINT), as well as certain open source structured datasets (structured OSINT). The core technology has also been applied by Numerica to detect distributed anomalies and advanced persistent threats (APTs) in cyber networks. Under the proposed effort, Numerica would upgrade Athena to exploit additional types of multi-INT data (including SIGINT), with the goal of demonstrating reduced false alarm rates and increased probability of anomalous event recognition. The Phase I program will culminate with a proof-of-concept demonstration of the I&W tool using combinations of real-world and simulated datasets.

award_title: Event Recognition for Space Situational Awareness
research_keywords: space object relationship characterization,abnormal relationship detection,intelligent systems,Event Relationship Recognition for SSA (ERRS),space situational awareness,Signals intelligence,MULTI-INT FUSION,Commercial Space Operations Center (ComSp
abstract: DF&NN and AGI will leverage the available multi-INT data from ComSpOC and AFRL to understand patterns in currently evolving situations in space (i.e., entity/event relationship information) and compare them to available truth to provide threat indications and warnings (I&W) knowledge left of significant events. SSA community tools being developed now are working on the first step to provide information to the warfighter from multi-INT data sources for the characterization of space objects and the identification of specific events of interest. Our intelligent system will learn patterns of life (e.g., correlations in normal entity/event relationships) to detect threat-caused abnormal relationship patterns. Our proposed approach is to divide & conquer this entity/event relationship learning, detection, and characterization problem into four types. We will apply the appropriate problem-to-solution mappings to each and integrate these into the Event Relationship Recognition for SSA (ERRS) prototype.ComSpOC will provide information from a network of diverse phenomenology global sensors. The ERRS will provide entity/event and relationship recognition, relationship learning, abnormal relationship detection, mission impact assessment, and CACM. The ERRS prototype will address selected portions of these based upon the data. We will extend our Performance Assessment and Process Management (PAPM) tools to evaluate experiments on ERRS.

award_title: Anti-Fragility Workstation for Resiliency (AWARE)
research_keywords: Anti-fragility,Resiliency,Virtual Machine,fault-tolerant,cloud,IntroVirt,Stars,instrumentation
abstract: AIS proposes the AWARE effort to research, design and prototype a system that will actually improve, rather than degrade, as faults or perturbations are experienced. Todays computer systems and mission assurance approaches are largely built on a foundation of static configurations and require manual upgrades or lengthy software development phases to increase the security or stability of a system. The concept of anti-fragility suggests that a system or process improves over time as it encounters issues or faults, rather than the current behavior, of degrading over time as faults are encountered. Under the AWARE effort the team will research, design, and prototype a multi-tiered infrastructure based on a series of abstractions and virtual machine (VM) technologies to provide a system that increases security and stability overtime as faults or issues are encountered.

award_title: Cyber-Inoculator
research_keywords: Anti-fragility,software systems,Virtualization,resilient systems,Cloud Computing
abstract: Cloud computing systems are rapidly growing in scale and complexity. The large-scale, complex and dynamic cloud environments make failure recovery and anomaly detection critical yet complex and time consuming tasks. Anti-fragility approaches are based on a concept that some systems could be rather strengthened by volatilities and faults. Hence, high-availability of cloud infrastructures must be complemented by leveraging anti-fragility properties, in order to increase system elasticity and resilience; embracing failure not only in the test environment but also in the production one, which would lead to a better preparation for the inevitable failures that may occur.To address this emerging need, Intelligent Automation Inc. (IAI) proposes the Cyber-Inoculator solution, aimed at building a comprehensive set of multi-layered system tools, methods, and capabilities to incrementally increase overall resiliency of the cloud and virtualization-based productionsystem through fault and error induction, failure analysis and localization,and automated code repair. Cyber-Inoculator neither requires target source code instrumentation nor depends on continuous system monitoring. Cyber-Inoculators are deployed on a host VM of a virtualized server, and supports wide specter number of different cloud-based enterprise fault-tolerant computing architectures.

award_title: Object Based Production (OBP) for Satellite Characterization
research_keywords: space situational awareness,machine learning,SIGINT,characterization,object based production,normality,indication and warning
abstract: The Expedition Technology team proposes, the Object-based Satellite Characterization, Analysis, and Reporting (OSCAR) program to addresses the goals of providing a robust framework for near real-time processing of a broad and growing set of sensor data for space situational awareness, and object characterization. We will integrate proven modern algorithms for characterization and fingerprinting in various phenomenologies utilizing a proven EO data processing chain and a novel SIGINT characterization algorithm. This system will demonstrate the viability to automatically classify by type, origin, function, and behavior. Modern machine learning algorithms will be employed for clustering, classification, and normality modeling, providing a robust trigger for Indications and Warning systems. In addition, proven algorithms and data structures will provide a foundation for detecting potential threats to US space systems. Our framework builds upon an understanding of the ongoing developments in multi-source intelligence for Object Based Production within the Department of Defense and Intelligence Community.

award_title: Multi-int Automated Satellite Characterization (MASC)
research_keywords: Space situational awareness (SSA),Space Object Characterization,Signals intelligence,Emitter Location,Object Based Framework (OBP),algorithm development,Multi-INT data fusion,Sensor Data Processing
abstract: As space continues to become more congested and contested, our ability to identify and mitigate man-made and natural threats to space assets becomes increasingly difficult.While the number of man-made objects being put into space each year increases, the intelligence community (IC), Department of Defense (DoD), US and International commercial companies are accelerating their monitoring capabilities and the amount of data being processed is expanding at an accelerating rate.Current capabilities enable us to generate initial tracks and preliminary orbit estimations in a matter of hours, however performing an in-depth characterization can take weeks to months, especially if the object is not cooperative.Technologies which leverage multi-INT data and provide for rapid correlation of available information for complete object characterization, including ability to assign attribution to hostile activity, is a necessity for improving U.S. SSA.It affords the U.S. the ability to take defensive action, reduces U.S. asset vulnerability and acts as a deterrent to those adversaries who may consider interfering with U.S. satellites. To address this problem, ExoAnalytic Solutions and SRI International propose Multi-int Automated Satellite Characterization (MASC), an innovative technology that will enable rapid space object correlation from the fusion of multiple data sources.

award_title: Innovative TWTs for VW Band Communications
research_keywords: traveling wave tube,millimeter wave frequencies,high efficiency and broad bandwidth performance,continuous wave operation,embedded magnetic beam focusing,impedance tuner,integrated RF interaction circuit,production manufacturable and product afford
abstract: Based on our experiences with our current E-band, 81-86 GHz Traveling wave tube (TWT), we understand that improvements are needed in efficiency, continuous wave operation, and overall bandwidth performance (gain flatness and output power flatness) across the entire 5 GHz as manufacturing of our current design is being pushed.Therefore, to achieve the above-mentioned performance improvements to obtain a successful VW/E-band TWT which meets the Air Forces requirements and sufficiently support future military satellite communications, innovative technical approaches of integrated RF interaction circuit, impedance tuners for the input and output couplers, and embedded magnetic focusing will be studied and developed.In addition to these innovative designs, we will also need to investigate new manufacturing techniques for implementing the innovative approaches.For all of these, we will perform tradespace analyses of candidate technologies, identify and design innovative TWT architectures and prototype proof-of-concept devices in Phase I study to show feasibility of the success of Phase II hardware development.Based on the solid foundation InnoSys has in high millimeter wave TWTs, we plan to develop an innovative TWT architecture that achieves high output powers with high efficiency across broad bandwidth while minimizing the unit cost and complexity goal of the Air Force.

award_title: Innovative TWTs for VW Band Communications
research_keywords: TWT,microwave tubes,W band,high frequency amplifier,traveling wave tube
abstract: We propose to investigate TWTs based on novel slow-wave structures that can generate 100 W of continuous wave power in the V and W bands. We will evaluate a class of structures that are robust and easy to build using a combination of conventional machining and electrode discharge machining. The proposed techniques are based on our successful fabrication of high power capable overmoded coupled cavity circuits for V-band TWTs. The fabrication techniques will be chosen to allow scaling of the proposed technology to higher frequencies such as the G-band. The various subsystems of the TWT will be modeled and optimized using the latest suite of electromagnetic, particle-in-cell and beam-wave interaction codes.

award_title: Assessing and Projecting Situations and Impacts in Space (APSIS)
research_keywords: space situational awareness,Situation awareness,threat assessment,command and control,Space Domain Awareness,Multi-INT,Indications and Warnings
abstract: The primary objective of this effort is to develop a framework for providing enhanced space situational awareness (SSA) through the ability to project and visualize threats to blue space assets, and assess the impact of those threats to the assets and the missions they support. The Assessing and Projecting Situations In Space (APSIS) framework leverages a domain agnostic TRL 6 capability for reducing multi-INT data to perform situation identification and threat assessment.
